translation.text: The Gurmukh eradicates egotism from within.

melody.description: Gauri creates a mood where the listener is encouraged to strive harder in order to achieve an objective. However, the encouragement given by the Raag does not allow the ego to increase. This therefore creates the atmosphere where the listener is encouraged, but still prevented from becoming arrogant and self-important.

author.author: Guru Amar Das
author.description:
Guru Amar Das [1479 - 1574] was the third Guru of the Sikhs, born at Basarke in Amritsar. His father, Tej Bhan and mother Bakht Kaur were orthodox Hindus. He became the oldest Sikh Guru.

Guru Amar Das put an end to tradition of sati, the burning of the widow on her husbands funeral pyre, and encouraged the remarriage of widows. He opened 22 preaching centres called Manjees and founded the town of Goindwal as the headquarters for the Sikh community.

translation.text: No filth sticks to the Gurmukh.

melody.description: Gauri creates a mood where the listener is encouraged to strive harder in order to achieve an objective. However, the encouragement given by the Raag does not allow the ego to increase. This therefore creates the atmosphere where the listener is encouraged, but still prevented from becoming arrogant and self-important.

translation.text: The Naam, the Name of the Lord, comes to dwell within the mind of the Gurmukh. ||2||

melody.description: Gauri creates a mood where the listener is encouraged to strive harder in order to achieve an objective. However, the encouragement given by the Raag does not allow the ego to increase. translation.text: Through karma and Dharma, good actions and righteous faith, the Gurmukh becomes true.

melody.description: Gauri creates a mood where the listener is encouraged to strive harder in order to achieve an objective. However, the encouragement given by the Raag does not allow the ego to increase. This therefore creates the atmosphere where the listener is encouraged, but still prevented from becoming arrogant and self-important.

melody.description: Gauri creates a mood where the listener is encouraged to strive harder in order to achieve an objective. translation.text: The Gurmukh is attuned to the Naam, and is at peace. ||3||

melody.description: Gauri creates a mood where the listener is encouraged to strive harder in order to achieve an objective. However, the encouragement given by the Raag does not allow the ego to increase. text: ਜੋ ਕਿਛੁ ਕਮਾਵੈ ਸੁ ਥਾਇ ਨ ਪਾਈ ॥

translation.text: No matter what they do, it is not acceptable.

transliteration.text: jō kish kamāvai s thāi n pāī .

However, the encouragement given by the Raag does not allow the ego to increase. translation.text: They come and go in reincarnation, and find no place of rest. ||5||

However, the encouragement given by the Raag does not allow the ego to increase. text: ਬਗ ਜਿਉ ਲਾਇ ਬਹੈ ਨਿਤ ਧਿਆਨਾ ॥

translation.text: They sit there, like storks, pretending to meditate.

transliteration.text: bag jiu lāi bahai nit dhiānā .

text: ਇਸੁ ਜੁਗ ਕਾ ਧਰਮੁ ਪੜਹੁ ਤੁਮ ਭਾਈ ॥

author.description:
Guru Amar Das [1479 - 1574] was the third Guru of the Sikhs, born at Basarke in Amritsar. His father, Tej Bhan and mother Bakht Kaur were orthodox Hindus. He became the oldest Sikh Guru.

Guru Amar Das put an end to tradition of sati, the burning of the widow on her husbands funeral pyre, and encouraged the remarriage of widows. He opened 22 preaching centres called Manjees and founded the town of Goindwal as the headquarters for the Sikh community.

text: ਸੋ ਜਨੁ ਸਾਚਾ ਜਿ ਹਉਮੈ ਮਾਰੈ ॥

translation.text: Those humble beings are true, who conquer their ego.

transliteration.text: sō jan sāchā j haumai mārai .

melody.description: Gauri creates a mood where the listener is encouraged to strive harder in order to achieve an objective. However, the encouragement given by the Raag does not allow the ego to increase. This therefore creates the atmosphere where the listener is encouraged, but still prevented from becoming arrogant and self-important.

translation.text: From him emanated the gods, enticed by desire.

text: ਤ੍ਰੈ ਗੁਣ ਭਰਮੇ ਨਾਹੀ ਨਿਜ ਘਰਿ ਵਾਸਾ ॥੧॥

translation.text: They wander in the three qualities, and they do not dwell within their own home. ||1||

transliteration.text: trai gun bharamē nāhī nij ghar vāsā .1.

text: ਅਨਦਿਨੁ ਭਗਤਿ ਹਰਿ ਨਾਮੁ ਦ੍ਰਿੜਾਇਆ ॥੧॥ ਰਹਾਉ ॥

translation.text: He has implanted devotional worship of the Lord's Name, night and day. ||1||Pause||

transliteration.text: anadin bhagat har nām drirāiā .1. rahāu .

text: ਪੜਿ ਵਾਦੁ ਵਖਾਣਹਿ ਸਿਰਿ ਮਾਰੇ ਜਮਕਾਲਾ ॥

translation.text: Reading about the debates and disputes, they are hit over the head by the Messenger of Death.

transliteration.text: par vād vakhānah sir mārē jamakālā .
